document_data.name: Rainbow Monastery
document_data.mainbody: The '''Rainbow Monastery''' was a [[monastery]] located next to the [[Rainbow Falls]] in the [[Katakoro Shan]] mountain range in [[Ra-Khati]]. It was dedicated to [[Byubo]], the Padhasattva of Nyum (audacious courage), of the [[Padhran religion]].
document_data.Description:
Six colored structures spread along the [[Rainbow Trail]] comprised the Rainbow Monastery. They were:
* Red Tower
* Orange Cloister
* Yellow Abbey
* Green Hospice
* Blue Grotto
* Purple Priory
document_data.Activities: Members of the [[Order of Rainbow Monks]] were stationed at each of the separate hospices. In exchange for donations, the monks aided travelers in moving their goods up the steep ascent of the Rainbow Trail.
document_data.History: When [[Yamun Khahan]] [[Grand Army of the Tuigan|army]] passed through the region during the mighty conquest during the midâ€“14th century [[DR]], a group of deserters seized the monastery as their own, believing it to be an ideal spot to exact tolls from travelers.
